Adding lots of easy quality of life things like Urgot execute range, Pyke execute range, and now Sona resource bar? How about adding more, an execute range for Darius and Garen, a range indicator for Kog'maw with W activated etc. 

It's weird to only do these courtesy kind of helpful information given to a few champs when multiple could make good use of it

Their lack of indicators is actually an intentional choice; Darius's, for example, is because they wanted it to be a skill test. Pyke's R can be missed, and Urgot's R can be missed as well; Darius's skill test comes from stacking up his bleed and then gauging whether or not it will actually kill them, which is important because it's a point-and-click ability. The same goes to Garen's R.

The basic idea behind it is that there are some things you should know because it can lock you out of getting the MINIMUM out of the ability, while others shouldn't be given out freely because it'd consistently give players the MOST out of the ability.
So what about cho?
He's not supposed to require skill to play, duh.
Cho has always had an indicator, they just made it easier by putting it on the health bar as well.
What about Karthus? Enemies already have a chance to recover before it hits, why not give Karthus players an indicator?
Because Karthus doesn't do true dmg.

They've said before on ask riot that they didn't want to give Garen or Darius an indicator because it's not only for the execute, they deal quite a bit damage by themselves. Hell, Evelyn's indicator only shows that she gets bonus damage, not if she can execute, so maybe they could do something along those lines? But at that point you'd have to give everyone with percent missing health an indicator (Akali, Lee Sin, etc.)

As for Kog'Maw, you can press A to see your attack range. I really recommend using it on him as it allows you to attack move more efficiently.
That reasoning for Darius and Garen doesn't hold up because Riot gave Cho Gath an indicator for his ultimate/execute...They should add the indicator for Garen/Darius or remove it from Cho.
Cho'Gath will kill them if they are with that range because its an execute like Pyke. Garen and Darius don't have flat out execute damage, it's just raw damage.

Cho Gath's ult is NOT an execute.  It seems like it is due to how instantaneous it is, and the fact that it deals true damage, but Cho's ult deals the same damage no matter how much health the opponent has left.
killing with Cho'Gaths ult is imperative to his kit. if he misses it, he doesn't grow. if Garen misses it, he finishes the kill and moves on.
Why give Darius and Garen another advantage?

I don't understand why Garen should have a shield that doesn't even last a full second. The previous version on live had damage reduction and tenacity that increased its uptime based on ranks. .75 seconds is pitiful compared to his opponents that can maintain a shield upward to 5 seconds. This does not include possible lag differences in game activating the ability.

Plus, a magic shield doesn't really fall in line with his theme which Riot still hasn't managed properly since hinting his involvement with Kayle's new story.

Reducing his overall durability and allowing regeneration against non-epic monsters is conveying that Riot wants Garen in the jungle, not in a lane.

Does Garen even qualify as a "juggernaut" anymore? He barely did beforehand, but now these changes push him further away from that.

Riot, please establish a specific class and theme identity for Garen. His design is all over the place.

Yea I agree.

In the same "rework" they give him better AS scaling pushing him into Duelist/Diver territory, while also giving him a % Max HP shield which is a Juggernaut/tank theme......

I love that they finally gave him AS scaling on E and gave Q cast time AS scaling. But the Reduction of his Armor/% Damage reduction and replacing it with a weak ass shield + small buffs to Regen really hurts his dueling power.

I wish they had some how tied W Active to his Passive. Maybe giving him his passive Regen x2 while not being lost during combat over the duration of the active.
